H0.text: Reading a book about farm fields is the activity that would best help the hiker determine whether air is warmer in the forest than in the nearby farm field.

H1.text: Making a weather prediction for the forests is the activity that would best help the hiker find out whether the air is warmer in the forest than in the nearby farm field.

H2.text: Measuring the wind speed at both locations is the activity that would best help the hiker determine whether air is warmer in the forest than in the nearby farm field.

H3.text: Recording the temperatures at both locations is the best activity for the hiker to determine whether air is warmer in the forest than in the nearby farm field.

A4.text: datasets consisting of repeated standardized measurements can be used to assess temperature trends

A5.text: the wind chill factor makes the weather feel colder under windy conditions than calm conditions even though a glass thermometer shows the same temperature
